        weaponID - Id of the card

    • Method Detail

      • checkAvailableMode

        public boolean[] checkAvailableMode()
                             throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Check which modes of the weapon can be used by player that has this weapon
        Specified by:
        checkAvailableMode in class WeaponCard
        Returns:
        array of booleans of size 2 the first represent the basic mode , the second the effect "with shadowstep" and the third the effect "with slice and dice"
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this card doesn't belong at a player

      • checkBasicModeAllTargetPossible

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<ColorId>> checkBasicModeAllTargetPossible()
                                                                                        throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Return a hash map with key the square and value a list of all player in that square There aren't squares without player It can become useful about the mode basic of cyberblade in some specially case of utilization In general this hash map contains all possible target for cyberblade
        Returns:
        all player that can be affected with the Cyberblade in basic mode
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the basic mode can't be used

      • checkWithShadowStep

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> checkWithShadowStep()
                                                     throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Return the list of all squares available for using the effect "with shadowstep" of this weapon this square are selectable by player Only if this mode being used after the basic effect
        Returns:
        all the square where the player can move
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the effect can't be used

      • basicMode

        public void basicMode(Player player,
                      java.lang.String[] orderEffect,
                      Player player2,
                      int x,
                      int y)
               throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        It uses the basic mode of the Cyberblade with additivity effects or not
        Parameters:
        player - player affected by weapon in the basic effect
        orderEffect - array that represent the order of the effect and what of those apply
        player2 - player affected by weapon in the "with slice and dice" effect (can be null if mode don't used)
        x - coordinate x of the square used for "with shadowstep" effect (if effect is off it doesn't use)
        y - coordinate y of the square used for "with shadowstep" effect (if effect is off it doesn't use)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the basic mode can't be used

        Parameters:
        responseMessage - response message specified for the weapon
